projectDesc.p: "姚氏妾" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: Yao Hong from Kuaiji bought a concubine.
She was adept at embroidery and culinary matters.

app.lem: 且有姿色, 又慧黠謹飭,
app.rdg: Moreover, she was attractive, smart, perspicacious and rule following.

app.lem: 能承迎人, 自主母以下皆愛之.
app.rdg: She had a sweet mouth and as a result, from her mother-in-law to those under her all liked her very much.

app.lem: 居數月久, 一夕, 姚氏舉家覺寒氣滿室, 切切逼人,
app.rdg: After several months, one evening, the entire Yao family felt the cold air in the room, which pressed every single one of them.

app.lem: 巳而聞鬼哨一聲, 從窗間出.
app.rdg: Suddenly they heard a shriek of a ghost, which exited from the windows.
The Yao family was shocked and scared.

app.lem: 稍定, 方舉燭相存問,
app.rdg: When they calmed down, they held candles and checked on each other.

app.lem: 視其榻, 衣裘皆在焉.
app.rdg: They examined her bed and found her clothes on it.
On the window paper there was a small opening as small as a coin.
We do not know what kind of monster this was.
This was reported by Guo Tanglao.
